alert.note: Alert for Andrews; Borden; Crane; Dawson; Ector; Gaines; Martin; Midland; Pecos; Upton; Ward; Winkler (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 25 at 12:19AM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTH CENTRAL PECOS...ECTOR... ANDREWS...EASTERN WARD...MIDLAND...EASTERN GAINES...EASTERN WINKLER...NORTHWESTERN BORDEN...MARTIN...CRANE...DAWSON AND WESTERN UPTON COUNTIES THROUGH 115 AM CDT... At 1219 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles west of Welch to 10 miles east of Kermit to 14 miles northeast of Monahans to 7 miles southeast of Grandfalls. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Midland, Odessa, Andrews, Lamesa, Monahans, Seminole, Crane, Grandfalls, Goldsmith, Lenorah, Midland International Air and Space Port, Gaines County Airport, Welch, West Odessa, Lamesa Municipal Airport, Los Ybanez, Cotton Flat, Imperial Reservoir, Patricia, and Arvana. This includes Interstate 20 between mile markers 81 and 145. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Andrews; Borden; Crane; Dawson; Ector; Gaines; Martin; Midland; Pecos; Upton; Ward; Winkler
